title: Principles of X-Rays
brief_description: In an age of historical introduction the work of Rontgen, von Laue and Bragg is recalled to explain the nature of X-rays. The generations of X-rays is considered; application of the quantum theory showing the composition of the “White” X-ray spectrum; deals with line spectra, X-ray crystallography, illustrates the measurement of X-ray and of inter-atomic distances and summarizes he applications of X-rays for research.
